reviewText: This is not right !!!!  Either put all of the seasons and episodes on DVD or none.  Cripe.  What's wrong with these people?  YOu have crap like Doogie Howser on several seasons, but St. Elsewhere for only one?  Even NEtflix doesn't have it, so must be the manufacturers who put these series on DVD's.  Very disappointing.  VERY !!!
summary: Why not more seasons to show?

reviewText: No, SHOUT should NOT buy this series, They DO NOT caption/subtitle most (any?) of their products. In fact, they should get out of the DVD releasing business for years injustice to the hearing impaired.The current St Elsewhere copyright holder should release the rest of the series pronto! Isn't Howie Mandel on national TV these days? Isn't Ed Begley Jr showing up everywhere these days? David Morse in many movies? Then, of course, these Denzel Washington -- a movie star!!!If you don't capitalize on this free PR to sell this series now, you never will sell it!Geez!

reviewText: Considered by many critics to be one of the ALL-TIME great TV dramas. So then, would someone please tell me why we have FOUR seasons of DOOGIE FREAKIN' HOWSER on DVD and only ONE of St. Elsewhere?Please release season TWO.
summary: One of the all time great TV dramas.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When looking back on the decades of TV, St. Elsewhere stands above the heap of moronic shows in a class by itself.  All the hospital dramas try, and fail with what seems like no effort at all, to duplicate the balance that the show had. Each character had such a rich and compelling presence!  The depth of the characters, the content of the stories unfolding every week, are peerless.  I would laugh, then cry in every episode.  The quality remained superior throughout the run of the show.  Please release the rest of the episodes as an example of what is worthy to spend time watching.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Warner Bros. Home Entertainment have done a SUPER, SUPER, SUPER job with their regular releases of the genre-lifting medical drama "ER".  Now, who can come to the party by releasing the remaining seasons of the medical drama standard-setting "St. Elsewhere".  Please, Please, PLEASE Twentieth Century Fox Home Entertainment!!!!!  Obviously, from previous reviews and comments, there are a whole legion of fans who will not give up on this television literary masterpiece.

reviewText: WHERE is the rest of this fantastic series??It's truly sad when current moronic shows are being released every day, but classics like St. Elsewhere collect dust.  Pathetic.WHOEVER owns the rights, PLEASE get a clue.
Title: N/A

reviewText: St. Elsewhere was my favorite show in the 1980s. It aspired me to become a cardiologist but I only wanted to play one. I still can't figure why this series hasn't been completely released to the public. It was one of the best dramas ever on television. TV Guide named it one of the Best Drama ever in television history. It was an unbelievable masterpiece of reality with both seriousness and lighthearted humor. The cast and crew worked as a team and never received the Best Drama from the Emmys. But they were awarded Emmys nonetheless as well as other accolades.To understand what made great television, all you had to do is watch the Tartikoff lineup on NBC in the 1980s under his reign. St. Elsewhere was one of his favorites .Today, they would have been canceled if they didn't get high ratings. Too bad, great television is largely ignored. It wasn't just a great medical drama but a human drama as well. What a cast too! The names like Denzel Washington, Howie Mandel, Ed Begley Jr., Christina Pickles, Ed Flanders, William Daniels, Norman Lloyd, Bonnie Bartlett, and others helped make this show must watch television of it's day.I hope they release this season as well as the other unreleased seasons too. St. Elsewhere is sorely missed today but I'll never forget wanting and aspiring to be doctor with the obstacles, hard work, studying, and lack of sleep. St. Elsewhere aired story lines that was groundbreaking even in the 1980s.
summary: Please Release the Best Medical Drama That Ever Was!
Title: N/A
